  specialized abbreviation for floating-point operations per second: a unit for measuring a computer's speed, based on how many of a particular type of mathematical operation it can do in a second: FLOPS can be calculated using an equation. The terms FLOPS and MFLOPS (megaFLOPS) were coined in order to be able to compare the performance of supercomputers. See also
gigaflop
More examplesFewer examplesThe processor could achieve 200+ GFLOP (200 billion floating-point operations per second).One way to measure the performance of a computer is by its "flops" - not its failures, but the number of floating-point operations it can perform each second.
